The documentation is here. Note that we highly recommend using AdvantageScopes Mechanism 2d support for the 3D field rather than articulated components.

docs.advantagescope.org

Custom Assets | AdvantageScope

AdvantageScope uses a default set of flat field images, field models, robot models, and joystick configurations. Simple assets (e.g. evergreen fields) are included in the initial installation. Detailed assets (e.g. season-specific fields) are...

jonahb55:

Mechanism 2d support for the 3D field rather than articulated components.

I second this, setting up the full 3d robot takes way longer than you would expect. Especially if you have not done it before, or arent very familiar with rotation/pose3d

To create the robot in 3D, do I necessarily need an Apple laptop, or can it be an Android device? Because when I access Show Assets Folder, only the README file appears.

You have to make the folder yourself, I would check out the docs that were posted above. AdvantageScope should be able to run on most hardware, but check the releases page to make sure your system is supported.
